q: former Republican presidential candidate hit back yesterday over unflattering comments made by Mr Donald Rumsfeld in his new autobiography, Known and Unknown. Reviving a feud between the pair, Mr Donald Rumsfeld describes John McCain in his book as a man with a hair-trigger temper and a propensity to fashion and shift his positions to appeal to the media . wake of the Tucson tragedy, politicians from both sides of the aisle have called for a more civil discourse in our political debate. On CBS's Face the Nation this morning, John McCain ( R-AZ) said, There is a lack of respect in our dialogue.... We shouldn't mistake passion for advocacy. In other words, passion is necessary in this debate that we're having, but we've got to make sure it doesn't spill over into personal attacks and impugning people's character or patriotism. people. Remember when Sen. Bernie Sanders Boehner promised a 100 Billion in spending cuts just in the first year if they won in Nov. 2010. Here is the actual quote from their`` Pledge to America''. With common-sense exceptions for seniors, veterans, and our troops, we will roll back government spending to prestimulus, pre-bailout levels, saving us at least$ 100 billion in the first year alone and putting us on a path to begin paying down the debt, balancing the budget, and ending the spending spree in Washington that threatens our children's future .
